intro: Epinetrum exellianum, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue and bloom in late winter to early spring. Epinetrum exellianum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
